comment._content: Koji Yamada was a billiards expert from Japan. He played Willie Hoppe (LC Bain photo) several times for the 18.2 and 14.1 billiards title. In a 1914 match, Hoppe overcame a 210 point defecit to defeate Yamada. A Nov 3 1912 NY Times Article ("Jap Billiardist to Play for Title") has a short bio. Yamada had been living for two years in Berlin. At the time he was the shortest contender for the billiards title. He was ambidextrous and seldom used a bridge. He is described as "matter of fact", "prompt", and efficient. Included in a 1910's Brunswick ad for the Billiards Experts of the World.
